qas.question: What year were hops first believed to be added to beer?
On what continent were hops first added to beer?
What was a Carolingian Abbot credited for adding to beer in 822?
Who was believed to have added hops to beer in 1067?
What was a Carolingian Abbot credited for adding to beer in 1067?
In which year did the Germanic and Celtic tribes add hops to beer?
What town first added hops to beer?

plausible_answers.text: fruits, honey, numerous types of plants, spices and other substances such as narcotic herbs

qas.question: In addition to hops, what did the early European beers contain?
In 822 what did Abbess Hilegard add to beer?
What was spread through Europe as far back as 1067 BC?
Who was the second to mention hops in 1076?

context: <b10_0>Beer<b10_0/> was spread through Europe by Germanic and Celtic tribes as far back as 3000 BC, and it was mainly brewed on a domestic scale. The product that the early Europeans drank might not be recognised as beer by most people today. Alongside the basic starch source, the early European beers might contain <b8_0>fruits, honey, numerous types of plants, spices and other substances such as narcotic herbs<b8_0/>. What they did not contain was <a2_0><b5_0><b9_0><b11_0>hops<b11_0/><b9_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>, as that was a later addition, first mentioned in <a1_0>Europe<a1_0/> around <a0_0><b6_0>822<b6_0/><a0_0/> by a <b12_0>Carolingian Abbot<b12_0/> and again in 1067 by <a3_0><b13_0>Abbess Hildegard<a3_0/> of <a4_0><b7_0>Bingen<b13_0/><b7_0/><a4_0/>.
